TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpListenerPrefixCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<string>, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string>, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public Class HttpListenerPrefixCollection Implements ICollection(Of String), IEnumerable(Of String)

summary.span: 表示用於儲存 物件之統一資源識別元 (URI) 前置詞的集合。

span.span: Represents the collection used to store Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) prefixes for objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會傳回這個集合的執行個體。The property returns instances of this collection. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會建立，並將使用者指定前置詞，以其。The following code example creates an and adds user-specified prefixes to its . [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#2)]

Public Sub Add (uriPrefix As String)

param.span: ，可識別要在連入要求中進行比較的 URI 資訊。

span.span: A that identifies the URI information that is compared in incoming requests.

param.span: 前置詞必須以斜線 ("/") 結束。

span.span: The prefix must be terminated with a forward slash ("/").

summary.span: 將統一資源識別元 (URI) 前置詞加入至集合。

span.span: Adds a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) prefix to the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法會將受相關聯的前置詞的集合的 URI 前置詞物件。This method adds a URI prefix to the set of prefixes managed by the associated object. 當檢查`uriPrefix`以便確保它是否有效，忽略大小寫。When checking `uriPrefix` to ensure it is valid, case is ignored. 例如，URI 前置詞字串組成的配置 （http 或 https）、 主機、 選用連接埠和選擇性路徑，「`http://www.contoso.com:8080/customerData``/`"。A URI prefix string is composed of a scheme (http or https), a host, an optional port, and an optional path, for example, "`http://www.contoso.com:8080/customerData``/`". 前置詞必須以斜線 ("/") 結束。The prefix must be terminated with a forward slash ("/"). 最符合要求的 URI 的前置詞與回應要求。The with the prefix that most closely matches a requested URI responds to the request. 多個物件無法加入相同的前置詞。Multiple objects cannot add the same prefix. 擲回例外狀況如果新增已經在前置詞使用。An exception is thrown if an adds a prefix that is already in use. 指定連接埠時，裝載項目都可以使用取代"`*`"表示接受要求傳送至連接埠，如果要求的 URI 不符合任何前置詞。When a port is specified, the host element can be replaced with "`*`" to indicate that the accepts requests sent to the port if the requested URI does not match any other prefix. 比方說，若要接收的所有要求傳送至連接埠 8080 當要求的 URI 不由處理任何其他，前置詞"`http://*:8080``/`"。For example, to receive all requests sent to port 8080 when the requested URI is not handled by any other , the prefix is "`http://*:8080``/`". 同樣地，以指定接受所有的要求傳送至連接埠，取代的主機項目 」`+`"character，"`https://+:8080`/"。Similarly, to specify that the accepts all requests sent to a port, replace the host element with the "`+`" character, "`https://+:8080`/". 「`*`"和"`+`"字元可出現在 包含路徑的前置詞。The "`*`" and "`+`" characters can be present in prefixes that include paths. 從.NET 4.5.3 和 Windows 10，萬用字元子網域中支援所管理的 URI 前置詞物件。Starting with .NET 4.5.3 and Windows 10, wildcard subdomains are supported in URI prefixes that are managed by an object. 指定萬用字元子網域，請使用"*"做為 URI 前置詞中的主機名稱的一部分的字元:，例如`http://*.foo.com/`，並將此做為引數傳遞給 HttpListenerPrefixCollection.Add 方法。To specify a wildcard subdomain, use the "*" character as part of the hostname in a URI prefix: for example, `http://*.foo.com/`, and pass this as the argument to the HttpListenerPrefixCollection.Add method. 這會處理.NET 4.5.3 和 Windows 10。在舊版中，這會產生 This will work on .NET 4.5.3 and Windows 10; in earlier versions, this would generate an ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會建立，並將使用者指定前置詞，以其。The following code example creates an and adds user-specified prefixes to its . [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#2)]

span.span: These are the only schemes supported for objects.
-or-

span.span: This exception is thrown if another has already added the prefix .

summary.span: 從集合移除所有統一資源識別元 (URI) 前置詞。

span.span: Removes all the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) prefixes from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 之後呼叫這個方法，您無法啟動關聯但不會加入新的前置詞; 如果您嘗試這樣做，請擲回例外狀況。After calling this method, you cannot start the associated without adding new prefixes; if you try to do so, an exception is thrown. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會移除中的所有首碼。The following code example removes all prefixes in an . [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法所傳回的物件一開始位於此集合中的第一個項目之前。The object that is returned by this method is initially positioned before the first element in this collection. 您必須呼叫方法，才能存取第一個項目。You must call the method before you can access the first element. 若要存取目前位置的項目，呼叫屬性。To access the element at the current position, call the property. 請勿修改時使用的列舉值集合。Do not modify the collection while using the enumerator. 如果列舉值時，會修改集合使用，請嘗試將位置設定藉由呼叫或導致。If the collection is modified while an enumerator is in use, an attempt to set the position by calling or causes an . 列舉值的詳細說明，請參閱文件類別和方法。For a detailed description of enumerators, see the documentation for the class and the method. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何列舉集合。The following code example demonstrates enumerating through a collection. 請注意，Visual Basic 和 C# 範例會使用語言特定的陳述式，在列舉集合，而不是擷取列舉值。Note that the Visual Basic and C# examples use language specific statements to enumerate through the collection instead of retrieving the enumerator. [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsSynchronized { get; }

summary.span: 取得值，指示對集合的存取是否為同步的 (安全執行緒)。

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread-safe).
This property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 透過集合進行列舉在本質上並非安全執行緒程序。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使集合經過同步化，其他的執行緒仍可修改該集合，使列舉值擲回例外狀況。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要保證列舉過程的執行緒安全，您可以在整個列舉過程中鎖定集合，或攔截由其他執行緒的變更所產生的例外狀況。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.
